intro: Roemeria hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid roemeria, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Roemeria hybrida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or alpine environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
